title: Melania's 'miserable, virtually trapped inside Trump Tower and didn't want to be First Lady', US media claims - Mirror Online
text:

Melania Trump is reportedly miserable and struggling to get to grips with her role as First Lady, according to bombshell claims being made in US media. 
While Donald Trump has embraced his being able to wield his power as US President from day one - and is wallowing in being the centre of attention - it's claimed his wife is hating the scrutiny which comes with the role. 
It's even being claimed by 'insiders' she is living 'virtually trapped inside Trump Tower' - 'fearing venturing out' of its gold-plated front door. 
Late night TV chatshow host Jimmy Kimmel even joked last week that she's “trapped like Rapunzel” in her $100 million penthouse. 
The latest issue of Us Weekly quotes family friend and stylist Phillip Bloch as saying: "This life wasn’t her dream. It was Donald’s. 
“Truthfully, it’s a lot to cope with.” It was literally day one - at the inauguration - that alarm bells started ringing when the world saw the look on Melania's face Melania has remained in New York while the couple's son Barron, 10, attends school (Photo: Getty) 
Melania, 46, has remained living in New York while their son Barron, 10, finishes school - but it's claims has only left the apartment "a handful of times". 
Us Weekly says that Melania used to take her son to and from his private school in a chauffeured SUV. 
Now, according to a family source, it says: “Melania has the Secret Service take Barron to school and retrieve him.” Melania and her husband haven't looked comfortable at each other's side (Photo: AFP) The pair have attended events together - but their body language has caused media speculation (Photo: Mirror.co.uk) 
While she was never a fixture on the New York social scene, “she is staying hidden more” claims Bloch. 
And the family source says of the few times she has been seen by her husband's side: “Don’t let her smile in those photos fool you. 
“She hates this.” Melania hasn't embraced the role in the same way her predecessor Michelle Obama did (Photo: Rex) First Lady Melania Trump has attended important events with her husband (Photo: Rex Features) 
It's true that little has been seen of Melania in public since inauguration day. 
By contrast, during her first week in the job in 2009, Michelle Obama hosted an open house for selected members of the public - plus a party for White House staffers. 
A video on Us Weekly's website calls Melania a "reluctant First Lady" who is "struggling with the realities of her role." Melania left the penthouse to visit Palm Beach with husband Donald (Photo: Getty Images North America) The pair attended a Gala together at Palm Beach (Photo: REUTERS) 
The public backlash, it claims, has also been tough for her to deal with. 
She reportedly did enjoy supermodel Gigi Hadid's mocking impression of her on stage at the American Music Awards. 
Indeed, Us Weekly claims a source told them that she was horrified when the world made fun of her. Melania Trump moved to the US intent on establishing a career in fashion (Photo: Getty) Top designers are rumoured to fear a backlash by being associated with the Trump name (Photo: Rex Features) Read More Donald Trump discusses government business as the North Korean missile crisis unfolds at private members club 
To add salt to her wounds, top designers are rumoured to have declared that they won't be dressing the First Lady, with a source saying: "That entire world she used to enjoy is closed to her". 
Melania originally moved from Slovenia to the US in 1996 to launch a fashion career - with no apparent intention of entering the world of politics. 
US Weekly quotes their source as saying: “Melania is unhappy with how her life ended up. 
“She is miserable.” Trump held her close while he sang 'My Way' at the Liberty Ball (Photo: Getty Images North America) The US President and First Lady are emblematic for the American people (Photo: Getty) Read More Everyone has heart-eyes for Canadian PM Justin Trudeau - and here's the evidence 
There's no doubt that the fashion world is nervous to be associated with the Trump name. 
Fashion magazine Vogue faced immediate threats of a boycott when editor Anna Wintour touted Melania as a future cover star. 
And a libel lawsuit against claims made in a British media website - which claims harmed her “unique, once-in-a-lifetime opportunity … to launch a broad-based commercial brand," certainly hasn't helped stifle criticism of her dedication to the role. Melania laughs at one of Donald's jokes (Photo: REUTERS) The dance meanwhile continues... (Photo: AFP) Read More People are upset over this 'inappropriate' photo of Ivanka Trump sitting at her father's desk 
A Melania source however reportedly counters that “she is very happy with her life and is very much embracing the roles and responsibilities of First Lady". 
She has reportedly also hired a 'social secretary' and 'chief of staff' and will resume White House tours on March 7. Like us on Facebook
